derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: originally gipcyan, short for Egyptian (because gypsies were popularly supposed to have come from Egypt)

entry.def: A gypsy is a member of a race of people who travel from place to place, usually in caravans, rather than living in one place.

means.word_mean: 1. a member of a nomadic people originating in northern India and now living on all continents
2. the Indic language of the Gypsies
